snippet: Shiite men in Baghdad commemorated the Ashura holiday by cutting themselves and bleeding, at a time when Shiites are being attacked again by ISIS extremists.
abstract: Baghdad Journal; Shiite men in Baghdad commemorate Ashura holiday by cutting themselves and bleeding, debated practice known as Tabir; holiday, which commemorates the slaughter of Muhammad's grandson by the army of Yazid, has profound historical resonance as Shiites face growing threat from Islamic State extremists.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Shiite men in Baghdad commemorated the Ashura holiday by cutting themselves and bleeding, at a time when Shiites are being attacked again by ISIS extremists.

headline.main: Bloody and Belittled Shiite Ritual Draws Historic Parallels
headline.print_headline: Bloody and Belittled Shiite Ritual Draws Historic Parallels

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
